eState-01.Definition: Indicates which elements are required by the state

dAgency-01.Definition: The unique ID assigned to the EMS Agency which is associated with all state licensure numbers and information.

dAgency-02.Definition: The state-assigned provider number of the responding agency

dAgency-04.Definition: The state/territory which assigned the EMS agency number.

eCustomConfiguration-01.Definition: This is the title of the custom data element created to collect information that is not defined formally in NEMSIS Version 3.
eCustomConfiguration-01.V3Changes: Added to allow customized data elements to be inserted and collected from within the NEMSIS Version 3 standard.

eCustomConfiguration-02.Definition: The definition of the custom element and how it should be used.

eCustomConfiguration-03.Definition: The data type of the custom element.

eCustomConfiguration-04.Definition: Indication if the data element will accept multiple values.
eCustomConfiguration-04.V3Changes: Added to allow customized data elements to be inserted and collected from within the NEMSIS Version 3 standard.

eCustomConfiguration-05.Definition: The Usage (Mandatory, Required, Recommended or Optional) for the Custom Data Element.
eCustomConfiguration-05.V3Changes: Added to allow customized data elements to be inserted and collected from within the NEMSIS Version 3 standard.

eCustomConfiguration-06.Definition: The values which are associated with the Custom Data Element. Values would be the choices provided to the user when they document the Custom Data Element
eCustomConfiguration-06.V3Changes: Added to allow customized data elements to be inserted and collected from within the NEMSIS Version 3 standard.

eCustomConfiguration-07.ElementName: Custom Data Element Potential NOT Values (NV)
eCustomConfiguration-07.Definition: NOT Values (NV) associated with the custom element

eCustomConfiguration-08.ElementName: Custom Data Element Potential Pertinent Negative Values (PN)
eCustomConfiguration-08.Definition: Pertinent Negative Values (PN) associated with the custom element

eRecord-01.Definition: The unique number automatically assigned by the EMS agency for each Patient Care Report (PCR). This should be a unique number for the EMS agency for all of time.

eRecord-02.Definition: The name of the vendor, manufacturer, and developer who designed the application that created this record.

eRecord-03.Definition: The name of the application used to create this record.

eRecord-04.Definition: The version of the application used to create this record.

eResponse-01.Definition: The state-assigned provider number of the responding agency

eResponse-03.Definition: The incident number assigned by the 911 Dispatch System

eResponse-04.Definition: The internal EMS response number which is unique for each EMS Vehicles (Unit) response to an incident within an EMS Agency.

eResponse-05.Definition: The type of service or category of service requested of the EMS Agency responding for this specific EMS event

eResponse-06.Definition: The main reason the EMS Unit is on Standby as the Primary Type of Service for the EMS event.

eResponse-07.Definition: The primary role of the EMS Unit which responded to this specific EMS event

eResponse-08.Definition: The dispatch delays, if any, associated with the dispatch of the EMS unit to the EMS event.

eResponse-09.Definition: The response delays, if any, of the EMS unit associated with the EMS event.

eResponse-10.Definition: The scene delays, if any, of the EMS unit associated with the EMS event.

eResponse-11.Definition: The transport delays, if any, of the EMS unit associated with the EMS event.

eResponse-12.Definition: The turn-around delays, if any, of EMS unit associated with the EMS event.

Codes.2212033: EMS Crew Accompanies Patient for Facility Procedure

eResponse-13.Definition: The unique physical vehicle number of the responding unit.

eResponse-14.Definition: The EMS unit number used to dispatch and communicate with the unit. This may be the same as the EMS Unit/Vehicle Number in many agencies.

eResponse-15.ElementName: Level of Care of This Unit
eResponse-15.Definition: The level of care (BLS or ALS) the unit is able to provide based on the units treatment capabilities for this EMS response.

eResponse-16.Definition: The EMS location or healthcare facility representing the geographic location of the unit or crew at the time of dispatch.

eResponse-17.Definition: The GPS coordinates associated with the EMS unit at the time of dispatch documented in decimal degrees.

eResponse-18.ElementName: Vehicle Dispatch Location US National Grid Coordinates
eResponse-18.Definition: The US National Grid Coordinates for the EMS Vehicles Dispatch Location.

eResponse-19.ElementName: Beginning Odometer Reading of Responding Vehicle
eResponse-19.Definition: The mileage (counter or odometer reading) of the vehicle at the beginning of the call (when the wheels begin moving). If EMS vehicle/unit is via water or air travel document the number in "hours" as it relates to the documentation of Boat, Fixed Wing, or Rotor Craft in eDisposition.16 (EMS Transport Method)

eResponse-20.ElementName: On-Scene Odometer Reading of Responding Vehicle
eResponse-20.Definition: The mileage (counter or odometer reading) of the vehicle when it arrives at the scene. If EMS vehicle/unit is via water or air travel document the number in "hours" as it relates to the documentation of Boat, Fixed Wing, or Rotor Craft in eDisposition.16 (EMS Transport Method)

eResponse-21.ElementName: Patient Destination Odometer Reading of Responding Vehicle
eResponse-21.Definition: The mileage (counter or odometer reading) of the vehicle when it arrives at the patients destination. If EMS vehicle/unit is via water or air travel document the number in "hours" as it relates to the documentation of Boat, Fixed Wing, or Rotor Craft in eDisposition.16 (EMS Transport Method)

eResponse-22.ElementName: Ending Odometer Reading of Responding Vehicle
eResponse-22.Definition: If using a counter, this is the mileage traveled beginning with dispatch through the transport of the patient to their destination and ending when back in service, starting from 0. If EMS vehicle/unit is via water or air travel document the number in "hours" as it relates to the documentation of boat, Fixed Wing, or Rotor Craft in eDisposition.16

eResponse-23.Definition: The indication whether the response was emergent or non-emergent. An emergent response is an immediate response (typically using lights and sirens).

eResponse-24.Definition: The documentation of response mode techniques used for this EMS response.

Codes.2224003: Intersection Navigation-With Automated Light Changing Technology
Codes.2224021: Initial No Lights or Sirens, Upgraded to Lights and Sirens
Codes.2224023: Initial Lights and Sirens, Downgraded to No Lights or Sirens

eDispatch-01.Definition: The complaint dispatch reported to the responding unit.

eDispatch-02.Definition: Indication of whether Emergency Medical Dispatch was performed for this EMS event.

Codes.2302007: Yes, Unknown if Pre-Arrival Instructions Given

eDispatch-03.Definition: The EMD card number reported by dispatch, consisting of the card number, dispatch level, and dispatch mode

eDispatch-04.Definition: The name or ID of the dispatch center providing electronic data to the PCR for the EMS agency, if applicable.
eDispatch-04.V3Changes: Added to the dataset to assist in identifying the CAD / dispatch center providing information to the EMS agency and ePCR when there are multiple dispatch centers sending resources to the same EMS incident.

eDispatch-05.Definition: The actual, apparent, or potential acuity of the patients condition as determined through information obtained during the EMD process.

eDispatch-06.Definition: The unique ID assigned by the CAD system for the specific unit response.

eCrew-01.Definition: The state certification/licensure ID number assigned to the crew member.

eCrew-02.Definition: The functioning level of the crew member ID during this EMS patient encounter.

eCrew-03.Definition: The role(s) of the role member during response, at scene treatment, and/or transport.

eTimes-01.Definition: The date/time the phone rings (911 call to public safety answering point or other designated entity) requesting EMS services.

eTimes-02.Definition: The date/time dispatch was notified by the 911 call taker (if a separate entity).

eTimes-03.Definition: The date/time the responding unit was notified by dispatch.

eTimes-04.Definition: The date/time the dispatch was acknowledged by the EMS Unit.

eTimes-05.Definition: The date/time the unit responded; that is, the time the vehicle started moving.

eTimes-06.Definition: The date/time the responding unit arrived on the scene; that is, the time the vehicle stopped moving at the scene.

eTimes-07.Definition: The date/time the responding unit arrived at the patients side.

eTimes-08.ElementName: Transfer of EMS Patient Care Date/Time
eTimes-08.Definition: The date/time the patient was transferred from this EMS agency to another EMS agency for care.

eTimes-09.Definition: The date/time the responding unit left the scene with a patient (started moving).

eTimes-10.ElementName: Arrival at Destination Landing Area Date/Time
eTimes-10.Definition: The date/time the Air Medical vehicle arrived at the destination landing area.

eTimes-11.Definition: The date/time the responding unit arrived with the patient at the destination or transfer point.

eTimes-12.ElementName: Destination Patient Transfer of Care Date/Time
eTimes-12.Definition: The date/time that patient care was transferred to the destination healthcare facilities staff.

eTimes-13.Definition: The date/time the unit back was back in service and available for response (finished with call, but not necessarily back in home location).

eTimes-14.Definition: The date/time the unit was canceled.

eTimes-15.ElementName: Unit Back at Home Location Date/Time
eTimes-15.Definition: The date/time the responding unit was back in their service area. With agencies who utilized Agency Status Management, home location means the service area as assigned through the agency status management protocol.

eTimes-16.Definition: The date/time the responding unit completed all tasks associated with the event including transfer of the patient, and such things as cleaning and restocking.

ePatient-01.Definition: The unique ID for the patient within the Agency

ePatient-04.Definition: The patients middle name, if any

ePatient-06.Definition: The patients primary city or township of residence.

ePatient-07.Definition: The patients home county or parish of residence.

ePatient-08.Definition: The state, territory, or province where the patient resides.

ePatient-09.Definition: The patients ZIP code of residence.

ePatient-10.Definition: The country of residence of the patient.

ePatient-11.Definition: The census tract in which the patient lives

ePatient-14.Definition: The patients race as defined by the OMB (US Office of Management and Budget)

Codes.2514009: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

ePatient-15.Definition: The patients age (either calculated from date of birth or best approximation)

ePatient-16.Definition: The unit used to define the patients age

ePatient-19.Definition: The email address of the patient

ePatient-20.Definition: The state that issued the drivers license

ePayment-01.Definition: The primary method of payment or type of insurance associated with this EMS encounter

ePayment-02.Definition: Indication of whether a physician certification statement (PCS) is available documenting the medical necessity or the EMS encounter.

ePayment-03.Definition: The date the Physician Certification Statement was signed

ePayment-04.Definition: The reason for EMS transport noted on the Physician Certification Statement

Codes.2604011: Danger to self or others-seclusion (flight risk)
Codes.2604013: DVT requires elevation of lower extremity
Codes.2604017: Moderate to severe pain on movement
Codes.2604019: Morbid Obesity requires additional personnel/equipment to handle
Codes.2604023: Orthopedic device (backboard, halo, use of pins in traction, etc.) requiring special handling in transit
Codes.2604025: Restraints (Physical or Chemical) anticipated or used during transport
Codes.2604027: Risk of falling off wheelchair or stretcher while in motion (not related to obesity)
Codes.2604029: Severe Muscular weakness and de-conditioned state precludes any significant physical activity
Codes.2604033: Third Party assistance/attendant required to apply, administer, or regulate or adjust oxygen en route
Codes.2604035: Unable to maintain erect sitting position in a chair for time needed to transport, due to moderate muscular weakness and de-conditioning.
Codes.2604037: Unable to sit in chair or wheelchair due to Grade II or greater decubitus ulcers on buttocks.

ePayment-05.ElementName: Healthcare Provider Type Signing Physician Certification Statement
ePayment-05.Definition: The type of healthcare provider who signed the Physician Certification Statement

ePayment-06.ElementName: Last Name of Individual Signing Physician Certification Statement
ePayment-06.Definition: The last name of the healthcare provider who signed the Physician Certification Statement.

ePayment-07.ElementName: First Name of Individual Signing Physician Certification Statement
ePayment-07.Definition: The first name of the healthcare provider who signed the Physician Certification Statement.

ePayment-08.Definition: An indication of whether the patients current residence is within the EMS agency service area.

Codes.2608003: Not a Resident Within EMS Service Area

ePayment-09.Definition: The ID Number of the patients insurance company.

ePayment-10.Definition: The name of the patients insurance company.

ePayment-11.Definition: The billing priority or order for the insurance company.

ePayment-12.Definition: The mailing address of the Insurance Company

ePayment-13.Definition: The insurance companys city or township used for mailing purposes.

ePayment-14.Definition: The insurance companys state, territory, or province, or District of Columbia.

ePayment-16.V3Changes: Added to better document international addresses.

ePayment-17.Definition: The ID number of the patients insurance group.

ePayment-18.Definition: The ID number of the patients insurance policy

ePayment-19.Definition: The last (family) name of the person insured by the insurance company.

ePayment-20.Definition: The first (given) name of the person insured by the insurance company

ePayment-21.Definition: The middle name, if any, of the person insured by the insurance company.

ePayment-22.Definition: The relationship of the patient to the primary insured person

ePayment-58.Definition: The name of the patients insurance group.

ePayment-23.Definition: The last (family) name of the patients closest relative or guardian

ePayment-24.Definition: The first (given) name of the patients closest relative or guardian

ePayment-25.Definition: The middle name/initial, if any, of the closest patients relative or guardian.

ePayment-26.Definition: The street address of the residence of the patients closest relative or guardian.

ePayment-27.Definition: The primary city or township of residence of the patients closest relative or guardian.

ePayment-28.Definition: The state of residence of the patients closest relative or guardian.

ePayment-29.Definition: The ZIP Code of the residence of the patients closest relative or guardian.

ePayment-30.Definition: The country of residence of the patients closest relative or guardian.

ePayment-31.Definition: The phone number of the patients closest relative or guardian

ePayment-32.Definition: The relationship of the patients closest relative or guardian

ePayment-34.Definition: The street address of the patients employer

ePayment-35.Definition: The city or township of the patients employer used for mailing purposes.

ePayment-36.Definition: The state of the patients employer

ePayment-37.Definition: The ZIP Code of the patients employer

ePayment-38.Definition: The country of the patients employer

ePayment-40.Definition: The urgency in which the EMS agency began to mobilize resources for this EMS encounter.

ePayment-41.Definition: Documentation of the patients transport need based on mobility and/or physical capability.

ePayment-42.Definition: Documentation to show the patient care provided to the patient met the Specialty Care Transport Base Rate requirements.

ePayment-44.Definition: The CMS Ambulance Transport Reason Code for the transport.

Codes.A: Patient was transported to the nearest facility for care of symptoms, complaints, or both
Codes.B: Patient was transported for the benefit of a preferred physician
Codes.C: Patient was transported for the nearness of family members
Codes.D: Patient was transported for the care of a specialist or for availability of equipment
Codes.E: Patient was transferred to a Rehabilitation Facility

ePayment-45.Definition: Free text description providing the purpose of the round trip EMS transport based on CR109 field for CMS.
ePayment-45.V3Changes: Added to improve billing with electronic claims using X12

ePayment-46.Definition: Free Text Documentation providing the reason for use of a stretcher in the EMS patient transport.

ePayment-47.Definition: Documentation of the CRC03 through CRC07 requirements for CMS billing using X12 transactions.
ePayment-47.V3Changes: Added to improve billing with electronic claims using X12. The Codes and Descriptors updated Sept 2013 to meet the X12 5010 standard.

Codes.12: Patient is confined to a bed or chair (Use code 12 to indicate patient was bedridden during transport.)
Codes.01: Patient was admitted to a hospital
Codes.05: Patient was unconscious or in shock
Codes.06: Patient was transported in an emergency situation
Codes.07: Patient had to be physically restrained

ePayment-48.Definition: The mileage to the closest hospital facility from the scene. Documented only if the patient was transported to a facility farther away than the closest hospital.

ePayment-49.Definition: Documentation that the patient required an ALS assessment and it was performed.

ePayment-50.Definition: The CMS service level for this EMS encounter.

ePayment-51.Definition: The condition code associated with the CMS EMS negotiated rule-making process.

ePayment-52.Definition: The CMS Ambulance Fee Schedule Transportation and Air Medical Transportation Indicators are used to better describe why it was necessary for the patient to be transported in a particular way or circumstance.
ePayment-52.V3Changes: Name changed from Condition Code Modifier to CMS Transportation Indicator

Codes.C1: Interfacility Transport (Requires Higher level of care)
Codes.C3: Emergency Trauma Dispatch Condition Code (Major Incident or Mechanism of Injury)
Codes.C4: Medically Necessary Transport (Facility on Divert or Services Unavailable)
Codes.C5: BLS Transport of ALS Patient (ALS not available)
Codes.C6: ALS Response (Based on Dispatch Info) to BLS Patient (Condition)
Codes.D1: Long Distance-patients condition requires rapid transportation over a long distance
Codes.D2: Rare Circumstances, Traffic Patterns Precludes Ground Transport
Codes.D3: Time to the closest appropriate hospital due to the patients condition precludes ground transport; maximize clinical benefits
Codes.D4: Pick up Point not Accessible by Ground Transport

ePayment-53.Definition: Prior authorization code provided by the insurance carrier/payer.

ePayment-54.Definition: The Payer who has provided the Prior Authorization Code.

ePayment-55.Definition: The name of the supply used on the patient by the EMS Crew during the EMS event.
ePayment-55.V3Changes: Added to track EMS supplies for billing.

ePayment-56.Definition: The number of the specific supply item used on the patient by the EMS Crew during the EMS event.
ePayment-56.V3Changes: Added to track EMS supplies for billing.

ePayment-57.Definition: Payer type according to X12 standard.

eScene-01.Definition: Documentation that this EMS Unit was the first EMS Unit for the EMS Agency on the Scene

eScene-02.ElementName: Other EMS or Public Safety Agencies at Scene
eScene-02.Definition: Other EMS agency names that were at the scene, if any

eScene-03.ElementName: Other EMS or Public Safety Agency ID Number
eScene-03.Definition: The ID number for the EMS Agency or Other Public Safety listed in eScene.02

eScene-04.ElementName: Type of Other Service at Scene
eScene-04.Definition: The type of public safety or EMS service associated with Other Agencies on Scene

eScene-05.ElementName: Date/Time Initial Responder Arrived on Scene
eScene-05.Definition: The time that the initial responder arrived on the scene, if applicable.

eScene-06.Definition: Indicator of how many total patients were at the scene

eScene-07.Definition: Indicator if this event would be considered a mass casualty incident (overwhelmed existing EMS resources)

eScene-08.Definition: The color associated with the initial triage assessment/classification of the MCI patient.

eScene-09.Definition: The kind of location where the incident happened

eScene-10.Definition: The state, regulatory, or other unique number (code) associated with the facility if the Incident is a Healthcare Facility.

eScene-11.Definition: The GPS coordinates associated with the Scene.

eScene-12.Definition: The US National Grid Coordinates for the Scene.

eScene-13.Definition: The name of the facility, business, building, etc. associated with the scene of the EMS event.

eScene-14.Definition: The mile post or major roadway associated with the incident locations

eScene-15.Definition: The street address where the patient was found, or, if no patient, the address to which the unit responded.

eScene-16.Definition: The number of the specific apartment, suite, or room where the incident occurred.

eScene-17.Definition: The city or township (if applicable) where the patient was found or to which the unit responded (or best approximation)

eScene-18.Definition: The state, territory, or province where the patient was found or to which the unit responded (or best approximation)

eScene-19.Definition: The ZIP code of the incident location

eScene-20.Definition: The nearest cross street to the incident address or directions from a recognized landmark or the second street name of an intersection.
eScene-20.V3Changes: Added to better locate/document the scene (incident) location.

eScene-21.Definition: The county or parish where the patient was found or to which the unit responded (or best approximation)

eScene-22.Definition: The country of the incident location.

eScene-23.Definition: The census tract in which the incident occurred.
eScene-23.V3Changes: Added to improve the ability to use census and other demographic information within EMS research.

eSituation-01.Definition: The date and time the symptom began (or was discovered) as it relates to this EMS event. This is described or estimated by the patient, family, and/or healthcare professionals.
eSituation-01.V3Changes: Added to better define the EMS patient event.

eSituation-02.Definition: Indication whether or not there was an injury

eSituation-03.Definition: The type of patient healthcare complaint being documented.

eSituation-04.Definition: The statement of the problem by the patient or the history provider.

eSituation-06.ElementName: Time Units of Duration of Complaint
eSituation-06.Definition: The time units of the duration of the patients complaint

eSituation-07.Definition: The primary anatomic location of the chief complaint as identified by EMS personnel

eSituation-08.Definition: The primary organ system of the patient injured or medically affected.

eSituation-09.Definition: The primary sign and symptom present in the patient or observed by EMS personnel

eSituation-10.Definition: Other symptoms identified by the patient or observed by EMS personnel

eSituation-11.Definition: The EMS personnels impression of the patients primary problem or most significant condition which led to the management given to the patient (treatments, medications, or procedures).

eSituation-12.Definition: The EMS personnels impression of the patients secondary problem or most significant condition which led to the management given to the patient (treatments, medications, or procedures).

eSituation-13.Definition: The acuity of the patients condition upon EMS arrival at the scene.

eSituation-14.Definition: Indication of whether or not the illness or injury is work related.

eSituation-15.Definition: The occupational industry of the patients work.

Codes.2815003: Administrative and Support and Waste Management and Remediation Services
Codes.2815023: Mining, Quarrying, and Oil and Gas Extraction
Codes.2815031: Real Estate and Rental and Leasing

eSituation-16.V3Changes: Added to better describe work related injury.

Codes.2816003: Arts, Design, Entertainment, Sports, and Media Occupations
Codes.2816005: Building and Grounds Cleaning and Maintenance Occupations
Codes.2816019: Food Preparation and Serving Related Occupations
Codes.2816029: Life, Physical, and Social Science Occupations

eSituation-17.Definition: The activity the patient was involved in at the time the patient experienced the onset of symptoms or experienced an injury.

eSituation-18.Definition: The estimated date and time the patient was last known to be well or in their usual state of health. This is described or estimated by the patient, family, and/or bystanders.

eInjury-01.Definition: The category of the reported/suspected external cause of the injury.

eInjury-02.Definition: The mechanism of the event which caused the injury

eInjury-03.Definition: Field Triage Criteria for transport to a trauma center as defined by the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention and the American College of Surgeons-Committee on Trauma.
eInjury-03.V3Changes:
Added to better evaluate the CDC-ACS 2011 Guidelines for the Field Triage of Injured Patients.
Website: http://www.cdc.gov/FieldTriage/

Codes.2903001: Amputation proximal to wrist or ankle
Codes.2903003: Crushed, degloved, mangled, or pulseless extremity
Codes.2903005: Chest wall instability or deformity (e.g., flail chest)
Codes.2903015: All penetrating injuries to  head, neck, torso, and extremities proximal to elbow or knee
Codes.2903017: Respiratory Rate  <10 or >29 breaths per minute (<20 in infants aged <1 year) or need for ventilatory support
Codes.2903021: Two or more proximal long-bone fractures

eInjury-04.ElementName: Vehicular, Pedestrian, or Other Injury Risk Factor
eInjury-04.Definition: Field Triage Criteria for transport to a trauma center as defined by the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention and the American College of Surgeons-Committee on Trauma.
eInjury-04.V3Changes:
Added to better evaluate the CDC-ACS 2011 Guidelines for the Field Triage of Injured Patients.
Website: http://www.cdc.gov/FieldTriage/

Codes.2904001: Auto v. Pedestrian/Bicyclist Thrown, Run Over, or > 20 MPH Impact
Codes.2904003: Fall Adults: > 20 ft. (one story is equal to 10 ft.)
Codes.2904005: Fall Children: > 10 ft. or 2-3 times the height of the child
Codes.2904007: Crash Death in Same Passenger Compartment
Codes.2904009: Crash Ejection (partial or complete) from automobile
Codes.2904011: Crash Intrusion, including roof: > 12 in. occupant site; > 18 in. any site
Codes.2904013: Crash Vehicle Telemetry Data (AACN) Consistent with High Risk of Injury

eInjury-05.ElementName: Main Area of the Vehicle Impacted by the Collision
eInjury-05.Definition: The area or location of initial impact on the vehicle based on 12-point clock diagram.

eInjury-06.Definition: The seat row location of the vehicle at the time of the crash with the front seat numbered as 1

Codes.2906007: Passenger in other enclosed passenger or cargo area (non-trailing unit such as a bus, etc.)
Codes.2906009: Passenger in unenclosed passenger or cargo area (non-trailing unit such as a pickup, etc.)

eInjury-07.Definition: Safety equipment in use by the patient at the time of the injury

Codes.2908005: Airbag Deployed Other (knee, air belt, etc.)

eInjury-09.Definition: The distance in feet the patient fell, measured from the lowest point of the patient to the ground

eInjury-10.Definition: Documentation of the use of OSHA required protective equipment used by the patient at the time of injury.
eInjury-10.V3Changes: Added to better document personal protection equipment used by the patient associated with an injury.

eInjury-11.Definition: The agency providing the Automated Collision Notification (ACN) Data.
eInjury-11.V3Changes: Added to better incorporate advanced automated collision notification information.

eInjury-12.Definition: The Automated Collision Notification Incident ID.
eInjury-12.V3Changes: Added to better incorporate advanced automated collision notification information.

eInjury-13.Definition: The Automated Collision Notification Call Back Phone Number (US Only).
eInjury-13.V3Changes: Added to better incorporate advanced automated collision notification information.

eInjury-14.Definition: The Automated Collision Notification Incident Date and Time.
eInjury-14.V3Changes: Added to better incorporate advanced automated collision notification information.

eInjury-15.Definition: The Automated Collision Notification GPS Location.
eInjury-15.V3Changes: Added to better incorporate advanced automated collision notification information.

eInjury-16.Definition: The Automated Collision Notification Vehicle Body Type.
eInjury-16.V3Changes: Added to better incorporate advanced automated collision notification information.

eInjury-17.Definition: The Automated Collision Notification Vehicle Manufacturer (e.g., General Motors, Ford, BMW, etc.).
eInjury-17.V3Changes: Added to better incorporate advanced automated collision notification information.

eInjury-18.Definition: The Automated Collision Notification Vehicle Make (e.g., Cadillac, Ford, BMW, etc.).
eInjury-18.V3Changes: Added to better incorporate advanced automated collision notification information.

eInjury-19.Definition: The Automated Collision Notification Vehicle Model (e.g., Escalade, Taurus, X6M, etc.).
eInjury-19.V3Changes: Added to better incorporate advanced automated collision notification information.

eInjury-20.Definition: The Automated Collision Notification Vehicle Model Year (e.g., 2010).
eInjury-20.V3Changes: Added to better incorporate advanced automated collision notification information.

eInjury-21.Definition: The Automated Collision Notification Indication of Multiple Impacts associated with the collision.
eInjury-21.V3Changes: Added to better incorporate advanced automated collision notification information.

eInjury-22.Definition: The Automated Collision Notification Delta Velocity (Delta V) force associated with the crash.
eInjury-22.V3Changes: Added to better incorporate advanced automated collision notification information.

eInjury-23.Definition: The Automated Collision Notification of the High Probability of Injury.
eInjury-23.V3Changes: Added to better incorporate advanced automated collision notification information.

eInjury-24.Definition: The Automated Collision Notification Principal Direction of Force (PDOF).
eInjury-24.V3Changes: Added to better incorporate advanced automated collision notification information.

eInjury-25.Definition: The Automated Collision Notification Indication that the Vehicle Rolled Over.
eInjury-25.V3Changes: Added to better incorporate advanced automated collision notification information.

eInjury-26.Definition: The Automated Collision Notification Indication of the Occupant(s) Seat Location(s) within the vehicle.
eInjury-26.V3Changes: Added to better incorporate advanced automated collision notification information.

eInjury-27.Definition: Indication if seat is occupied based on seat sensor data.
eInjury-27.V3Changes: Added to better incorporate advanced automated collision notification information.

eInjury-28.Definition: The Automated Collision Notification Indication of Seatbelt use by the occupant(s).
eInjury-28.V3Changes: Added to better incorporate advanced automated collision notification information.

eInjury-29.Definition: The Automated Collision Notification Indication of Airbag Deployment.
eInjury-29.V3Changes: Added to better incorporate advanced automated collision notification information.

eArrest-01.Definition: Indication of the presence of a cardiac arrest at any time during this EMS event.

eArrest-02.Definition: Indication of the etiology or cause of the cardiac arrest (classified as cardiac, non-cardiac, etc.)

eArrest-03.Definition: Indication of an attempt to resuscitate the patient who is in cardiac arrest (attempted, not attempted due to DNR, etc.)

eArrest-04.Definition: Indication of who the cardiac arrest was witnessed by

eArrest-05.ElementName: CPR Care Provided Prior to EMS Arrival
eArrest-05.Definition: Documentation of the CPR provided prior to EMS arrival

eArrest-06.ElementName: Who Provided CPR Prior to EMS Arrival
eArrest-06.Definition: Documentation of who performed CPR prior to this EMS units arrival.

Codes.3006009: Other EMS Professional (not part of dispatched response)

eArrest-07.ElementName: AED Use Prior to EMS Arrival
eArrest-07.Definition: Documentation of AED use Prior to EMS Arrival

eArrest-08.ElementName: Who Used AED Prior to EMS Arrival
eArrest-08.Definition: Documentation of who used the AED prior to this EMS units arrival.

Codes.3008009: Other EMS Professional (not part of dispatched response)

eArrest-09.Definition: Documentation of the type/technique of CPR used by EMS.

eArrest-11.ElementName: First Monitored Arrest Rhythm of the Patient
eArrest-11.Definition: Documentation of what the first monitored arrest rhythm which was noted

eArrest-12.Definition: Indication whether or not there was any return of spontaneous circulation.

Codes.3012003: Yes, At Arrival at the ED
Codes.3012005: Yes, Prior to Arrival at the ED

eArrest-13.Definition: The level of cerebral performance of the patient at the time of discharge from the Hospital

eArrest-14.Definition: The date/time of the cardiac arrest (if not known, please estimate).

eArrest-16.Definition: The reason that CPR or the resuscitation efforts were discontinued.

Codes.3016011: Return of Spontaneous Circulation (pulse or BP noted)

eArrest-17.ElementName: Cardiac Rhythm on Arrival at Destination
eArrest-17.Definition: The patients cardiac rhythm upon delivery or transfer to the destination

eArrest-18.ElementName: End of EMS Cardiac Arrest Event
eArrest-18.Definition: The patients outcome at the end of the EMS event.
eArrest-18.V3Changes: Added to better identify the outcome of EMS cardiac arrest patients.

eArrest-19.Definition: The initial date and time that CPR was started by anyone.

eHistory-01.Definition: Indication of whether or not there were any patient specific barriers to serving the patient at the scene

eHistory-02.Definition: The last name of the patients practitioner

eHistory-03.Definition: The first name of the patients practitioner

eHistory-04.Definition: The middle name or initial of the patients practitioner.

eHistory-05.Definition: The presence of a valid DNR form, living will, or document directing end of life or healthcare treatment decisions.

Codes.3105011: State EMS DNR or Medical Order Form

eHistory-07.Definition: The patients known allergies to food or environmental agents.

eHistory-08.Definition: The patients pre-existing medical and surgery history of the patient

eHistory-09.Definition: Type of person medical history obtained from

eHistory-10.Definition: The immunization type of the patient.

eHistory-11.Definition: The year associated with each immunization type

eHistory-12.Definition: The medications the patient currently takes

eHistory-13.Definition: The numeric dose or amount of the patients current medication

eHistory-14.Definition: The dosage unit of the patients current medication

eHistory-15.Definition: The administration route (po, SQ, etc.) of the patients current medication

eHistory-16.Definition: Indication of the presence of the Emergency Information Form associated with patients with special healthcare needs.

eHistory-17.Definition: Indicators for the potential use of alcohol or drugs by the patient related to the patients current illness or injury.

Codes.3117009: Positive Level known from Law Enforcement or Hospital Record

eHistory-18.Definition: Indication of the possibility by the patients history of current pregnancy.

eHistory-19.Definition: Date and Time of last oral intake.
eHistory-19.V3Changes: Added to better document last oral intake.

eNarrative-01.Definition: The narrative of the patient care report (PCR).

eVitals-01.Definition: The date/time vital signs were taken on the patient.

eVitals-02.ElementName: Obtained Prior to this Units EMS Care
eVitals-02.Definition: Indicates that the information which is documented was obtained prior to the documenting EMS units care.

eVitals-03.Definition: The cardiac rhythm / ECG and other electrocardiography findings of the patient as interpreted by EMS personnel.

eVitals-04.Definition: The type of ECG associated with the cardiac rhythm.
eVitals-04.V3Changes: Added to better document ECG results.

eVitals-05.V3Changes: Added to better document ECG results.

eVitals-08.Definition: Indication of method of blood pressure measurement.

eVitals-09.V3Changes: Added for additional patient monitoring capability.

eVitals-10.Definition: The patients heart rate expressed as a number per minute.

eVitals-11.Definition: The method in which the Heart Rate was measured. Values include auscultated, palpated, electronic monitor).
eVitals-11.V3Changes: This data element was added when Pulse Rate and Electronic Monitor Rate were merged as EVitals.10.

eVitals-13.Definition: The clinical rhythm of the patients pulse.

eVitals-14.Definition: The patients respiratory rate expressed as a number per minute.

eVitals-16.Definition: The numeric value of the patients exhaled end tidal carbon dioxide (ETCO2) level measured as a unit of pressure in millimeters of mercury (mmHg).

eVitals-17.Definition: The numeric value of the patients carbon monoxide level measured as a percentage (%) of carboxyhemoglobin (COHb).
eVitals-17.V3Changes: Added to allow use of new patient monitoring devices.

eVitals-19.Definition: The patients Glasgow Coma Score Eye opening.

Codes.1: No eye movement when assessed (All Age Groups)
Codes.2: Opens Eyes to painful stimulation (All Age Groups)
Codes.3: Opens Eyes to verbal stimulation (All Age Groups)

eVitals-20.Definition: The patients Glasgow Coma Score Verbal.

Codes.3: Inappropriate words (>2 Years); Inconsistently consolable, moaning
Codes.4: Confused (>2 Years); Cries but is consolable, inappropriate interactions
Codes.5: Oriented (>2 Years); Smiles, oriented to sounds, follows objects, interacts

eVitals-21.Definition: The patients Glasgow Coma Score Motor

Codes.6: Obeys commands (>2Years); Appropriate response to stimulation

eVitals-22.Definition: Documentation of factors which make the GCS score more meaningful.

Codes.3322003: Initial GCS has legitimate values without interventions such as intubation and sedation

eVitals-23.Definition: The patients total Glasgow Coma Score.

eVitals-24.Definition: The patients body temperature in degrees Celsius/centigrade.

eVitals-25.Definition: The method used to obtain the patients body temperature.

eVitals-26.Definition: The patients highest level of responsiveness.

eVitals-27.Definition: The patients indication of pain from a scale of 0-10.

eVitals-28.Definition: The type of pain scale used.
eVitals-28.V3Changes: Added to better document the patients pain level.

eVitals-29.Definition: The findings or results of the Stroke Scale Type (eVitals.30) used to assess the patient exhibiting stroke-like symptoms.

eVitals-30.Definition: The type of stroke pain scale used.
eVitals-30.V3Changes: Added to include additional detail on the stroke scale used.

eVitals-31.Definition: The results of the patients Reperfusion Checklist for potential Thrombolysis use.

eLabs-01.ElementName: Date/Time of Laboratory or Imaging Result
eLabs-01.Definition: The data and time for the specific laboratory result
eLabs-01.V3Changes: Added to better document patient care.

eLabs-02.ElementName: Study/Result Prior to this Units EMS Care
eLabs-02.Definition: Indicates that the laboratory result occurred prior to this EMS units care.
eLabs-02.V3Changes: Added to better document EMS care.

eLabs-03.Definition: The type of the laboratory value.
eLabs-03.V3Changes: Added to provide for the documentation of laboratory results obtained prior to or during and EMS patient encounter.

eLabs-04.Definition: The value or result of the laboratory test (Units may vary).
eLabs-04.V3Changes: Added to better document EMS care.

eLabs-05.Definition: The type of x-ray or imaging study.
eLabs-05.V3Changes: Added to better describe the EMS patient care.

eLabs-06.Definition: The description or interpretation of the results of the imaging study.
eLabs-06.V3Changes: Added to better describe the EMS Patient Care

eLabs-07.ElementName: Imaging Study File or Waveform Graphic Type
eLabs-07.Definition: The description of the image study file or waveform graphic stored in Imaging Study File or Waveform Graphic (eLabs.08).

eLabs-08.ElementName: Imaging Study File or Waveform Graphic

eExam-01.Definition: The patients body weight in kilograms either measured or estimated

eExam-02.Definition: The length-based color as taken from the tape.

eExam-04.Definition: The assessment findings associated with the patients skin.

Codes.3504035: Capillary Nail Bed Refill less than 2 seconds
Codes.3504039: Capillary Nail Bed Refill more than 4 seconds

eExam-05.Definition: The assessment findings associated with the patients head.

eExam-06.Definition: The assessment findings associated with the patients face.

eExam-07.Definition: The assessment findings associated with the patients neck.

eExam-08.Definition: The assessment findings associated with the patients chest/lungs.

eExam-09.Definition: The assessment findings associated with the patients heart.

eExam-10.Definition: The location of the patients abdomen assessment findings.

eExam-11.Definition: The assessment findings associated with the patients abdomen.

eExam-12.Definition: The assessment findings associated with the patients pelvis/genitourinary.

eExam-13.ElementName: Back and Spine Assessment Finding Location
eExam-13.Definition: The location of the patients back and spine assessment findings.

eExam-14.Definition: The assessment findings associated with the patients spine (Cervical, Thoracic, Lumbar, and Sacral) and back exam.

eExam-15.Definition: The location of the patients extremity assessment findings.

eExam-16.Definition: The assessment findings associated with the patients extremities.

eExam-17.Definition: The location of the patients eye assessment findings.

eExam-18.Definition: The assessment findings of the patients eye examination.

eExam-19.Definition: The assessment findings of the patients mental status examination.

eExam-20.Definition: The assessment findings of the patients neurological examination.

eExam-21.Definition: Indication if the Stroke/CVA Symptoms resolved and when.

eProtocols-01.Definition: The protocol used by EMS personnel to direct the clinical care of the patient

Codes.9914017: Cardiac Arrest-Ventricular Fibrillation/ Pulseless Ventricular Tachycardia
Codes.9914075: General-Universal Patient Care/ Initial Patient Contact
Codes.9914183: General-Law Enforcement - Blood for Legal Purposes
Codes.9914185: General-Law Enforcement - Assist with Law Enforcement Activity
Codes.9914201: Cardiac Arrest-Determination of Death / Withholding Resuscitative Efforts

eProtocols-02.Definition: The age group the protocol is written to address
eProtocols-02.V3Changes: Added to better document protocol use.

eMedications-01.Definition: The date/time medication administered to the patient

eMedications-02.ElementName: Medication Administered Prior to this Units EMS Care
eMedications-02.Definition: Indicates that the medication administration which is documented was administered prior to this EMS units care

eMedications-03.Definition: The medication given to the patient
eMedications-03.PNList: PN.UnableToComplete; PN.Refused; PN.MedicationAlreadyTaken; PN.MedicationAllergy; PN.DeniedByOrder; PN.ContraindicationNoted;

eMedications-04.Definition: The route medication was administered to the patient

eMedications-05.Definition: The dose or amount of the medication given to the patient

eMedications-06.Definition: The unit of medication dosage given to patient

eMedications-07.Definition: The patients response to the medication

eMedications-08.Definition: Any complication (abnormal effect on the patient) associated with the administration of the medication to the patient by EMS

eMedications-09.Definition: The statewide assigned ID number of the EMS crew member giving the treatment to the patient

eMedications-10.Definition: The type (level) of EMS or Healthcare Professional Administering the Medication. For medications administered prior to EMS arrival, this may be a non-EMS healthcare professional.
eMedications-10.V3Changes: Added to better document the type of healthcare professional who administered the medication.

eMedications-11.Definition: The type of treatment authorization obtained

eMedications-12.Definition: The name of the authorizing physician ordering the medication administration if the order was provided by any manner other than protocol (standing order) in EMedications.11

eProcedures-01.Definition: The date/time the procedure was performed on the patient

eProcedures-02.ElementName: Procedure Performed Prior to this Units EMS Care
eProcedures-02.Definition: Indicates that the procedure which was performed and documented was performed prior to this EMS units care.

eProcedures-03.Definition: The procedure performed on the patient.

eProcedures-04.Definition: The size of the equipment used in the procedure on the patient

eProcedures-05.Definition: The number of attempts taken to complete a procedure or intervention regardless of success.

eProcedures-06.Definition: Indicates that this individual procedure attempt which was performed on the patient was successful.

eProcedures-07.Definition: Any complication (abnormal effect on the patient) associated with the performance of the procedure on the patient

eProcedures-08.Definition: The patients response to the procedure

eProcedures-09.Definition: The statewide assigned ID number of the EMS crew member performing the procedure on the patient

eProcedures-10.ElementName: Role/Type of Person Performing the Procedure
eProcedures-10.Definition: The type (level) of EMS or Healthcare Professional performing the procedure. For procedures performed prior to EMS arrival, this may be a non-EMS healthcare professional.
eProcedures-10.V3Changes: Added to document the type of healthcare professional performing the procedure.

eProcedures-11.Definition: The type of treatment authorization obtained

eProcedures-12.Definition: The name of the authorizing physician ordering the procedure, if the order was provided by any manner other than protocol (standing order) in eProcedures.11

eProcedures-13.Definition: The location of the vascular access site attempt on the patient, if applicable.

eAirway-01.Definition: The clinical indication for performing invasive airway management.
eAirway-01.V3Changes: Added to better document airway management.

Codes.4001001: Adequate Airway Reflexes/Effort, Potential for Compromise

eAirway-02.Definition: The date and time the airway device placement was confirmed.
eAirway-02.V3Changes: Added to better document airway management.

eAirway-03.Definition: The airway device in which placement is being confirmed.
eAirway-03.V3Changes: Added to better document airway management. SAD means Supraglottic Airway  Device.

eAirway-04.Definition: The method used to confirm the airway device placement.
eAirway-04.V3Changes: Added to better document airway management.

Codes.4004011: Direct Re-Visualization of Tube in Place

eAirway-05.Definition: The measurement at the patients teeth/lip of the tube depth in centimeters (cm) of the invasive airway placed.

eAirway-06.ElementName: Type of Individual Confirming Airway Device Placement
eAirway-06.Definition: The type of individual who confirmed the airway device placement.
eAirway-06.V3Changes: Added to better document airway management.

Codes.4006001: Another Person on the Same Crew

eAirway-07.Definition: The statewide assigned ID number of the EMS crew member confirming the airway placement.
eAirway-07.V3Changes: Added to better document airway management.

eAirway-08.Definition: The airway management complications encountered during the patient care episode.
eAirway-08.V3Changes: Added to better document airway management.

Codes.4008013: Injury or Trauma to Patient from Airway Management Effort
Codes.4008023: Tube Was Not in Correct Position when EMS Crew/Team Assumed Care of the Patient

eAirway-09.ElementName: Suspected Reasons for Failed Airway Management
eAirway-09.Definition: The reason(s) the airway was unable to be successfully managed.
eAirway-09.V3Changes: Added to better document airway management.

Codes.4009003: ETI Attempted, but Arrived At Destination Facility Before Accomplished
Codes.4009009: Inadequate Patient Relaxation/Presence of Protective Airway Reflexes
Codes.4009019: Unable to Position or Access Patient

eAirway-10.ElementName: Date/Time Decision to Manage the Patient with an Invasive Airway
eAirway-10.Definition: The date and time the decision was made to manage the patients airway with an invasive airway device.
eAirway-10.V3Changes: Added to better document airway management.

eAirway-11.ElementName: Date/Time Invasive Airway Placement Attempts Abandoned
eAirway-11.Definition: The date and time that the invasive airway attempts were abandoned for the patient.
eAirway-11.V3Changes: Added to better document airway management.

eDevice-01.Definition: The unique manufacturers serial number associated with a medical device.

eDevice-02.Definition: The time of the event recorded by the devices internal clock

eDevice-03.Definition: The type of event documented by the medical device.

eDevice-04.Definition: The description of the waveform file stored in Waveform Graphic (eDevice.05).

eDevice-06.ElementName: Medical Device Mode (Manual, AED, Pacing, CO2, O2, etc)
eDevice-06.Definition: The mode of operation the device is operating in during the defibrillation, pacing, or rhythm analysis by the device (if appropriate for the event)

eDevice-07.Definition: The lead or source which the medical device used to obtain the rhythm (if appropriate for the event)

eDevice-08.Definition: The interpretation of the rhythm by the device (if appropriate for the event)

eDevice-09.Definition: The type of shock used by the device for the defibrillation (if appropriate for the event)

eDevice-10.Definition: The energy (in joules) used for the shock or pacing (if appropriate for the event)

eDevice-11.Definition: The number of times the patient was defibrillated, if the patient was defibrillated during the patient encounter.

eDevice-12.Definition: The rate the device was calibrated to pace during the event, if appropriate.

eDisposition-01.Definition: The destination the patient was delivered or transferred to.

eDisposition-02.Definition: The code of the destination the patient was delivered or transferred to.

eDisposition-03.Definition: The street address of the destination the patient was delivered or transferred to.

eDisposition-04.Definition: The city of the destination the patient was delivered or transferred to (physical address).

eDisposition-05.Definition: The state of the destination the patient was delivered or transferred to.

eDisposition-06.Definition: The destination county in which  the patient was delivered or transferred to.

eDisposition-07.Definition: The destination ZIP code in which  the patient was delivered or transferred to.

eDisposition-09.Definition: The destination GPS Coordinates to which  the patient was delivered or transferred to.

eDisposition-10.ElementName: Destination Location US National Grid Coordinates
eDisposition-10.Definition: The US National Grid Coordinates for the Destination Location. This may be the Healthcare Facility US National Grid Coordinates.

eDisposition-11.ElementName: Number of Patients Transported in this EMS Unit
eDisposition-11.Definition: The number of patients transported by this EMS crew and unit.
eDisposition-11.V3Changes: Added to document multiple patients being transported with the same vehicle and crew.

eDisposition-12.Definition: Type of disposition treatment and/or transport of the patient by this EMS Unit.

Codes.4212013: Patient Dead at Scene-No Resuscitation Attempted (With Transport)
Codes.4212015: Patient Dead at Scene-No Resuscitation Attempted (Without Transport)
Codes.4212017: Patient Dead at Scene-Resuscitation Attempted (With Transport)
Codes.4212019: Patient Dead at Scene-Resuscitation Attempted (Without Transport)
Codes.4212031: Patient Treated, Transferred Care to Another EMS Unit
Codes.4212033: Patient Treated, Transported by this EMS Unit
Codes.4212035: Patient Treated, Transported by Law Enforcement
Codes.4212037: Patient Treated, Transported by Private Vehicle
Codes.4212041: Standby-Public Safety, Fire, or EMS Operational Support Provided

eDisposition-13.ElementName: How Patient Was Moved to Ambulance
eDisposition-13.Definition: The method the patient was moved to the ambulance from the scene

eDisposition-14.Definition: The position of the patient during transport from the scene

eDisposition-15.ElementName: How Patient Was Transported From Ambulance
eDisposition-15.Definition: The method the patient was moved from the ambulance to the destination

eDisposition-16.Definition: Transport method by this EMS Unit.
eDisposition-16.V3Changes: Added to better describe Air and Ground Transport methods.

eDisposition-17.Definition: Indication whether the transport was emergent or non-emergent.

eDisposition-18.Definition: The documentation of transport mode techniques for this EMS response.

Codes.4218003: Intersection Navigation-With Automated Light Changing Technology
Codes.4218017: Initial No Lights or Sirens, Upgraded to Lights and Sirens
Codes.4218019: Initial Lights and Sirens, Downgraded to No Lights or Sirens

eDisposition-19.Definition: The acuity of the patients condition after EMS care.

eDisposition-20.Definition: The reason the unit chose to deliver or transfer the patient to the destination

eDisposition-21.Definition: The type of destination the patient was delivered or transferred to

eDisposition-22.Definition: The location within the hospital that the patient was taken directly by EMS (e.g., Cath Lab, ICU, etc.).
eDisposition-22.V3Changes: Added to identify the location within the hospital that the patient was directly taken to by EMS.

eDisposition-23.Definition: The primary hospital capability associated with the patients condition for this transport (e.g., Trauma, STEMI, Peds, etc.).
eDisposition-23.V3Changes: Added to aid in determining if patients are transported to the appropriate hospital based on provider impression, assessment, and treatment.

eDisposition-24.ElementName: Destination Team Pre-Arrival Alert or Activation
eDisposition-24.Definition: Indication that an alert (or activation) was called by EMS to the appropriate destination healthcare facility team. The alert (or activation) should occur prior to the EMS Unit arrival at the destination with the patient.
eDisposition-24.V3Changes: Added to better document performance measure for acute time dependent illness and injury systems of care.

eDisposition-25.ElementName: Date/Time of Destination Prearrival Alert or Activation
eDisposition-25.Definition: The Date/Time EMS alerted, notified, or activated the Destination Healthcare Facility prior to EMS arrival. The EMS assessment identified the patient as acutely ill or injured based on exam and possibly specified alert criteria.
eDisposition-25.V3Changes: Added to better document performance measure for acute time dependent illness and injury systems of care.

eDisposition-26.Definition: Information provided to patient during disposition for patients not transported or treated.
eDisposition-26.V3Changes: Added to better document instructions given to patients not transported by EMS.

Codes.4226001: Contact 911 or see your Doctor if problem returns
Codes.4226003: Contact 911 or see your Doctor if problem worsens
Codes.4226009: See Your Doctor or the Emergency Department immediately
Codes.4226011: See Your Doctor or the Emergency Department in the next 24 hours
Codes.4226013: See Your Doctor or the Emergency Department in the next 4 hours
Codes.4226015: See Your Doctor within the next one week

eOutcome-01.Definition: The known disposition of the patient from the Emergency Department (ED)

Codes.20: Deceased/Expired (or did not recover - Religious Non Medical Health Care Patient)
Codes.30: Still a patient or expected to return for outpatient services.
Codes.43: Discharged/transferred to a Federal Health Care Facility (e.g., VA or federal health care facility)
Codes.61: Discharged/transferred within this institution to a hospital based Medicare approved swing bed.
Codes.62: Discharged/transferred to a inpatient rehabilitation facility including distinct part units of a hospital.
Codes.63: Discharged/transferred to long term care hospitals
Codes.64: Discharged/transferred to a nursing facility certified under Medicaid but not certified under Medicare
Codes.65: Discharged/transferred to a psychiatric hospital or psychiatric distinct part unit of a hospital.
Codes.66: Discharged/transferred to a Critical Access Hospital (CAH).
Codes.70: Discharged/transferred to another type of health care institution not defined elsewhere in the code list.
Codes.01: Discharged to home or self care (routine discharge)
Codes.02: Discharged/transferred to another short term general hospital for inpatient care
Codes.03: Discharged/transferred to a skilled nursing facility (SNF)
Codes.04: Discharged/transferred to an intermediate care facility (ICF)
Codes.05: Discharged/transferred to another type of institution not defined elsewhere in this code list
Codes.06: Discharged/transferred to home under care of organized home health service organization in anticipation of covered skills care
Codes.07: Left against medical advice or discontinued care
Codes.09: Admitted as an inpatient to this hospital.

eOutcome-02.Definition: The known disposition of the patient from the hospital, if admitted.

Codes.20: Deceased/Expired (or did not recover - Religious Non Medical Health Care Patient)
Codes.30: Still a patient or expected to return for outpatient services.
Codes.43: Discharged/transferred to a Federal Health Care Facility (e.g., VA or federal health care facility)
Codes.61: Discharged/transferred within this institution to a hospital based Medicare approved swing bed.
Codes.62: Discharged/transferred to a inpatient rehabilitation facility including distinct part units of a hospital.
Codes.63: Discharged/transferred to long term care hospitals
Codes.64: Discharged/transferred to a nursing facility certified under Medicaid but not certified under Medicare
Codes.65: Discharged/transferred to a psychiatric hospital or psychiatric distinct part unit of a hospital.
Codes.66: Discharged/transferred to a Critical Access Hospital (CAH).
Codes.70: Discharged/transferred to another type of health care institution not defined elsewhere in the code list.
Codes.01: Discharged to home or self care (routine discharge)
Codes.02: Discharged/transferred to another short term general hospital for inpatient care
Codes.03: Discharged/transferred to a skilled nursing facility (SNF)
Codes.04: Discharged/transferred to an intermediate care facility (ICF)
Codes.05: Discharged/transferred to another type of institution not defined elsewhere in this code list
Codes.06: Discharged/transferred to home under care of organized home health service organization in anticipation of covered skills care
Codes.07: Left against medical advice or discontinued care

eOutcome-03.Definition: The Type of External Report or Record associated with the Report/ID Number.
eOutcome-03.V3Changes: Added to allow documentation of external record and identification numbers.

eOutcome-04.Definition: The ID or Number of the external report or record in eOutcome.03.
eOutcome-04.V3Changes: Added to allow documentation of external record and identification numbers.

eOutcome-05.Definition: The type of external report/registry that was documented as "other" in eOutcome.03

eOutcome-06.Definition: The patients reason for seeking care or attention, expressed in the terms as close as possible to those used by the patient or responsible informant.
eOutcome-06.V3Changes: Added to better evaluate EMS patient care.

eOutcome-07.Definition: The first recorded Emergency Department Systolic Blood Pressure.
eOutcome-07.V3Changes: Added to better evaluate the outcome of EMS care.

eOutcome-08.ElementName: Emergency Department Recorded Cause of Injury
eOutcome-08.Definition: The documented cause of injury from the emergency department record.
eOutcome-08.V3Changes: Added to better evaluate EMS care.

eOutcome-09.Definition: The procedures performed on the patient during the emergency department visit.
eOutcome-09.V3Changes: Added to better evaluate EMS care.

eOutcome-10.Definition: The practitioners description of the condition or problem for which Emergency Department services were provided.
eOutcome-10.V3Changes: Added to better evaluate EMS care.

eOutcome-11.Definition: The date and time the patient was admitted to the hospital.
eOutcome-11.V3Changes: Added to better evaluate EMS care.

eOutcome-12.Definition: Hospital Procedures performed on the patient during the hospital admission.
eOutcome-12.V3Changes: Added to better evaluate EMS care.

eOutcome-13.Definition: The hospital diagnosis of the patient associated with the hospital admission.
eOutcome-13.V3Changes: Added to better evaluate EMS care.

eOutcome-14.Definition: The total number of patient days in any ICU (including all ICU episodes).
eOutcome-14.V3Changes: Added to better measure patient outcomes.

eOutcome-15.Definition: The total number of patient days spend on a mechanical ventilator (excluding time in the operating room).
eOutcome-15.V3Changes: Added to better measure and define patient outcome.

eOutcome-16.Definition: The date the patient was discharged from the hospital.
eOutcome-16.V3Changes: Added to better measure patient outcome.

eOutcome-17.Definition: The patients functional status at time of hospital discharge.

Codes.4317003: No significant disability despite symptoms; able to carry out all usual duties and activities
Codes.4317005: Slight disability; unable to carry out all previous activities, but able to look after own affairs without assistance
Codes.4317007: Moderate disability; requiring some help, but able to walk without assistance
Codes.4317009: Moderately severe disability; unable to walk without assistance and unable to attend to own bodily needs without assistance
Codes.4317011: Severe disability; bedridden, incontinent and requiring constant nursing care and attention

eCustomResults-01.Definition: The actual value or values chosen (if values listed in eCustomConfiguration.06) or result (free text, Date/Time, or number) documented for the Custom Data Element
eCustomResults-01.V3Changes: Added to allow customized data elements to be inserted and collected from within the NEMSIS Version 3 standard.

eCustomResults-02.Definition: References the CustomElementID attribute for eCustomConfiguration.CustomGroup

eCustomResults-03.ElementName: CorrelationID of PatientCareReport Element or Group
eCustomResults-03.Definition: References the CorrelationID attribute of an element or group in the PatientCareReport section

eOther-01.Definition: Indication of whether the PCR needs review by anyone.

eOther-02.Definition: An indication if the patient may meet the entry criteria for an injury or illness specific registry

eOther-03.Definition: The personal protective equipment which was used by EMS personnel during this EMS patient contact.

eOther-04.Definition: The ID number of the EMS Crew Member associated with eOther.03, eOther.05, eOther.06.
eOther-04.V3Changes: Added to better document EMS workplace health and safety issues.

eOther-05.ElementName: Suspected EMS Work Related Exposure, Injury, or Death
eOther-05.Definition: Indication of an EMS work related exposure, injury, or death associated with this EMS event.

eOther-06.ElementName: The Type of Work-Related Injury, Death or Suspected Exposure
eOther-06.Definition: The type of exposure or unprotected contact with blood or body fluids

Codes.4506009: Exposure-Body Fluid Contact to Broken Skin
Codes.4506013: Exposure-Body Fluid Contact with Intact Skin
Codes.4506015: Exposure-Body Fluid Contact with Mucosal Surface
Codes.4506017: Exposure-Needle Stick with Body Fluid Injection
Codes.4506019: Exposure-Needle Stick without Body Fluid Injection

eOther-07.ElementName: Natural, Suspected, Intentional, or Unintentional Disaster
eOther-07.Definition: Event caused by natural forces or Suspected and Intentional/Unintentional Disasters (terrorism).

eOther-08.Definition: The statewide assigned ID number of the EMS crew member which completed this patient care report

eOther-09.Definition: Document type which has been electronically stored with PCR.
eOther-09.V3Changes: Added to allow an improved implementation of electronic healthcare records.

eOther-10.Definition: The description of the file attachment stored in File Attachment Image (eOther.11).
eOther-10.V3Changes: Added to allow an improved implementation of electronic healthcare records.

eOther-11.Definition: The file that is attached electronically to the patient care report.
eOther-11.V3Changes: Added to allow an improved implementation of electronic healthcare records.

eOther-12.Definition: The individuals signature associated with eOther.15 (Signature Status).
eOther-12.V3Changes: Added to better document disposition and billing information.

Codes.4512003: EMS Primary Care Provider (for this event)

eOther-13.Definition: The reason for the individuals signature.

eOther-14.Definition: If Patient Representative is chosen as the owner of the signature, this documents the relationship of the individual signing to the patient.
eOther-14.V3Changes: Added to improve documentation on disposition and billing.

Codes.4514033: Other Care Provider (Home health, hospice, etc.)

eOther-15.Definition: Indication that a patient or patient representative signature has been collected or attempted to be collected.
eOther-15.V3Changes: Added to better document disposition and billing.

Codes.4515001: Not Signed - Crew Called out to another call
Codes.4515005: Not Signed - Due to Distress Level
Codes.4515009: Not Signed - In Law Enforcement Custody
Codes.4515017: Not Signed - Physical Impairment of Extremities
Codes.4515021: Not Signed - Transferred Care/No Access to Obtain Signature

eOther-16.Definition: The name of the graphic file for the signature.

eOther-17.Definition: The description of the file attachment stored in Signature Graphic (eOther.18).

eOther-18.Definition: The graphic file for the signature.
eOther-18.V3Changes: Added to better document disposition and billing.

eOther-19.Definition: The date and time the signature was captured.
eOther-19.V3Changes: Added to better document disposition and billing.

eOther-20.Definition: The last name of the individual who signed the associated signature.
eOther-20.V3Changes: Added to better document disposition and billing.

eOther-21.Definition: The first name of the individual associated with the signature.
eOther-21.V3Changes: Added to better document disposition and billing.
